items.summary: Persist glossary terms in the Motoko backend across canister upgrades so glossary data does not reset to empty after draft deployments.

Update the Glossary page empty-state logic so it only shows “Glossary is Empty” after glossary queries have actually fetched from the backend; if the backend actor is not yet available (e.g., draft config/connection issue), show a non-empty error/loading state instead of an empty glossary message.

Add lightweight diagnostics (developer-facing console logging is sufficient) in the Glossary data-fetch path to help differentiate between: (a) actor not initialized, (b) query disabled due to actor state, (c) successful fetch returning 0 terms, and (d) fetch error—so draft environment issues can be identified quickly.
